00038 MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener(std::vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00039                                                                QCProbesetOptions& psOpts,
00040                                                                ChipLayout* layout,
00041                                                                double k,
00042                                                                double emThresh,
00043                                                                double binSize,
00044                                                                std::string label) :
00045   m_ProbeSets(probeSets),
00046   m_psOpts(psOpts),
00047   m_layout(layout),
00048   m_K(k),
00049   m_EmThresh(emThresh),
00050   m_BinSize(binSize),
00051   m_Label(label)
00052 {
00053   declareMetrics();
00054   Verbose::out(2, "Initializing Multichannel HomHiLoCelListener Okay!");
00055   m_cel = NULL;
00056 }
00057 
00058 MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::~MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener()
00059 {
00060   // nothing.
00061 }
00062 
00063 void MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::declareMetrics()
00064 {
00065   // the reference version has "cqc" as part of the name.
00066   // what does "cqc" mean?
00067   declareMetric(m_Label+"-minhilo",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00068   declareMetric(m_Label+"-maxhilo",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00069   declareMetric(m_Label+"-aa-diff",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00070   declareMetric(m_Label+"-bb-diff",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00071   declareMetric(m_Label+"-bb-aa-diff",ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00072 }
00073 
00074 /** clear a probeset structure */
00075 void MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::clearProbeSet(ProbeSet &ps) {
00076   //check ownMem is true first
00077   delete [] ps.name;
00078   ps.name = NULL;
00079   ps.atoms.clear();
00080 };

00082 /**
00083  * Process another cel files worth of data.
00084  */
00085 void MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::newChip(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData* cel) 
00086 {
00087   std::string fileRoot=Fs::basename(cel->GetFileName());
00088 
00089   // Get Contrast Values
00090   vector<double> contrastValues;
00091 
00092   // grab copy of the pointer for tmp use.
00093   m_cel=cel;
00094   // need to edit here to change the contrast
00095   GimmeContrast(m_ProbeSets, contrastValues, m_K);
00096 
00097   Verbose::out(4, "contrastValues size is: " + ToStr(contrastValues.size()));
00098   // Find the 3 peaks in contrast values (AA, AB, BB)
00099   double peak1, peak2, peak3;
00100   computeClusterPeaks(contrastValues,peak1,peak2,peak3,m_EmThresh);
00101   Verbose::out(4,"MultiChannelHomHiLo - " + fileRoot + " -  " + m_Label +
00102                " - Peaks: " + ToStr(peak1) + ", " + ToStr(peak2) + ", " + ToStr(peak3));
00103 
00104   // Find the valleys
00105   double valley1 = computeClusterValley(contrastValues,peak1,peak2,m_BinSize);
00106   double valley2 = computeClusterValley(contrastValues,peak2,peak3,m_BinSize);
00107   Verbose::out(4,"MultiChannelHomHiLo - " + fileRoot + " -  " + m_Label +
00108                " - Valleys: " + ToStr(valley1) + ", " + ToStr(valley2));
00109 
00110   // How many contrast values under each peak
00111   double densityPeak1 = getContrastDensity(contrastValues,peak1,m_BinSize);
00112   double densityPeak3 = getContrastDensity(contrastValues,peak3,m_BinSize);
00113   Verbose::out(4,"MultiChannelHomHiLo - " + fileRoot + " -  " + m_Label +
00114                " - Peak Density: " + ToStr(densityPeak1) + ", " + ToStr(densityPeak3));
00115 
00116   // How many contrast values under each valley
00117   double densityValley1 = getContrastDensity(contrastValues,valley1,m_BinSize);
00118   double densityValley2 = getContrastDensity(contrastValues,valley2,m_BinSize);
00119   Verbose::out(4,"MultiChannelHomHiLo - " + fileRoot + " -  " + m_Label +
00120                " - Valley Density: " + ToStr(densityValley1) + ", " + ToStr(densityValley2));
00121 
00122   double minHomHiLo = 0.1;
00123   double maxHomHiLo;
00124   double aa_diff, bb_diff, bb_aa_diff;
00125 
00126   string minhilo_label    = m_Label+"-minhilo";
00127   string maxhilo_label    = m_Label+"-maxhilo";
00128   string aa_diff_label    = m_Label+"-aa-diff";
00129   string bb_diff_label    = m_Label+"-bb-diff";
00130   string bb_aa_diff_label = m_Label+"-bb-aa-diff";
00131 
00132   double mn1 = densityPeak1 - densityValley1;
00133   double mn2 = densityPeak3 - densityValley2;
00134 
00135   // Get Min
00136   if (mn1 < mn2)
00137     minHomHiLo = mn1;
00138   else
00139     minHomHiLo = mn2;
00140 
00141   Verbose::out(4,"MultichannelHomHiLo - " + fileRoot + " -  " + m_Label +
00142                " - mn1,mn2,min: " + ToStr(mn1) + ", " + ToStr(mn2) + ", " + ToStr(minHomHiLo));
00143 
00144   int chipIdx=getNextChipIdx();
00145 
00146   if (minHomHiLo == mn1)
00147     maxHomHiLo = mn2;
00148   else
00149     maxHomHiLo = mn1;
00150 
00151   setMetric(chipIdx,minhilo_label, minHomHiLo);
00152   setMetric(chipIdx,maxhilo_label, maxHomHiLo);
00153 
00154   if ((peak1 < peak2) && (peak2 < peak3)) {
00155     bb_diff = densityPeak1 - densityValley1;
00156     aa_diff = densityPeak3 - densityValley2;
00157     bb_aa_diff = bb_diff - aa_diff;
00158     setMetric(chipIdx,aa_diff_label, aa_diff);
00159     setMetric(chipIdx,bb_diff_label, bb_diff);
00160     setMetric(chipIdx,bb_aa_diff_label, bb_aa_diff);
00161   }
00162   else {
00163     Err::errAbort("MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::newMultiChannelChip() peaks are not in order: " +
00164                   ToStr(peak1) + " " + ToStr(peak2) + " " + ToStr(peak3));
00165   }
00166   //
00167   setValid(true);
00168 }

00189 /**
00190  * Calculate contrast values
00191  */
00192 ///@todo refactor? simmilar code in EmGenderCelListener
00193 /*
00194   double HomHiLoCelListener::CalculateEMContrast(FusionCELData* celA, FusionCELData* celB, const ProbeSet* ps, const double k) {
00195   float Amedian = -1, Bmedian = -1;
00196   bool medianOk = summarize(o, celA, celB, ps, Amedian, Bmedian);
00197   if(!medianOk || Amedian <= 0 || Bmedian <= 0) {
00198   Err::errAbort("MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::fillInContrastValues() - Warning. alleleMedian() failed for probeset: " +
00199   ToStr(ps->name));
00200   }
00201   double contrast = -2, strength = -2;
00202   ContrastExtremesStretch(k, Amedian, Bmedian, contrast, strength);
00203 
00204   if(fabs(contrast) > 1) {
00205   Err::errAbort("MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::fillInContrastValues() - Can't have abs(contrast) > 1 for probeset: " +
00206   ToStr(ps->name));
00207   }
00208   return contrast;
00209   }
00210 */
00211 /**
00212  * Compute the cluster peaks using EM
00213  */
00214 void MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::computeClusterPeaks(const std::vector<double>& contrastValues,
00215                                                          double &peak1,
00216                                                          double &peak2,
00217                                                          double &peak3,
00218                                                          double emThresh)
00219 {
00220   CEMSeed seed;
00221   seed.setMu(-0.66f, 0.0f, 0.66f);
00222   seed.setSigma(0.1f, 0.1f, 0.1f);
00223   seed.setWeight(0.33f, 0.34f, 0.33f);
00224   seed.setMinMu(-2.0f, -.05f, .25f);
00225   seed.setMinSigma(0.02f, 0.02f, 0.02f);
00226   seed.setMaxMu(-.25f, .05f, 2.0f);
00227   seed.setMaxSigma(.3f, .3f, .3f);
00228 
00229   CPrimeEM em;
00230   em.setData(contrastValues);
00231   em.setThreshold(emThresh);
00232   em.EMEstimate(seed);
00233   CEMEst* pEst = em.getEMEstimates();
00234 
00235   peak1 = pEst->m_mu[0];
00236   peak2 = pEst->m_mu[1];
00237   peak3 = pEst->m_mu[2];
00238 }
00239 
00240 /**
00241  * Compute the Valley Between Two Points
00242  */
00243 double MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::computeClusterValley(const std::vector<double>& contrast,
00244                                                             double x1,
00245                                                             double x2,
00246                                                             double bin){
00247   double valleyX = x1;
00248   double valleyDensity = getContrastDensity(contrast, valleyX, bin);
00249   double x = x1 + 2.0 * bin;
00250   while (x < x2) {
00251     double density = getContrastDensity(contrast, x, bin);
00252     if (density < valleyDensity){
00253       valleyX = x;
00254       valleyDensity = density;
00255     }
00256     x += 2.0 * bin;
00257   }
00258   return valleyX;
00259 }
00260 
00261 /**
00262  * Compute the density of values for a given bin
00263  */
00264 double MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::getContrastDensity(const std::vector<double>& contrast, double x, double bin){
00265   double lb = x - bin;
00266   double ub = x + bin;
00267   size_t n = contrast.size();
00268   int count = 0;
00269   for (size_t i=0; i < n; i++) {
00270     if ( (contrast[i]> lb) && (contrast[i] <= ub))
00271       count++;
00272   }
00273   return 100.0*(double(count)/double(n));
00274 }
00275 
00276 void MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::GimmeContrast(std::vector<ProbeListPacked>& probeSets,
00277                                                    std::vector<double>& contrastValues,
00278                                                    double k)
00279 {
00280   // "m_cel" is a pointer to the celfile we are working on.
00281   // this assumes that the AT channel is 1 and GC is 0
00282 
00283   std::string fileName=m_cel->GetFileName();
00284   std::string fileNameRoot=Fs::basename(fileName);
00285 
00286   Verbose::out(1, "computing contrast for '"+fileNameRoot+"' in MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::GimmeContrast");
00287   contrastValues.clear();
00288   contrastValues.reserve(probeSets.size());
00289 
00290   // Construct the analysis streams for each factory
00291   AnalysisStreamFactory asFactory;
00292   AnalysisStream* asStream;
00293 
00294   Verbose::out(1,"Allele estimates computed using: " + ToStr(m_psOpts.m_exprAnalysisString));
00295 
00296   //
00297   if(m_psOpts.m_sketchInFile!="") {
00298     asFactory.readTargetSketchFromFile(m_psOpts.m_sketchInFile);
00299   }
00300   asStream=asFactory.constructAnalysisStream(m_psOpts.m_exprAnalysisString,*m_layout);
00301   
00302   // Setup Intensity Mart for each channel
00303   std::vector<std::string> celFiles;
00304   celFiles.push_back(fileName);
00305   
00306   SparseMart* sMart=NULL;
00307   sMart = new SparseMart(m_layout->getProbeLayoutOrder(),
00308                                 celFiles, 
00309                                 true);
00310   
00311   // Setup CelReaders for each Channel
00312   CelReader cReader;
00313   cReader.registerStream(asStream->getChipStreamHead());
00314   cReader.registerIntensityMart(sMart);
00315 
00316   // Setup the MultiChannelQuantMethod
00317   MultiQuantMethodListener multiQuant;
00318   QuantMethodReportListener *listener = new QuantMethodReportListener();
00319   listener->registerListener(&multiQuant);
00320   asStream->addReporter(listener);
00321 
00322   // Dummies needed by the reporter
00323   PmOnlyAdjust pmAdjust;
00324   //ChipStream* iTran;
00325 
00326   //populate Chipstreams and pmAdjusters by taking advantage of analysisStream object
00327   std::vector<ChipStream*>* cStream; //now vector of vector of chip streams
00328   PmAdjuster* pmAdjuster; //now a vector of PmAdjuster
00329   cStream=asStream->getChipStream();
00330   pmAdjuster=asStream->getPmAdjuster();
00331 
00332   // register the cel files to open.
00333   Verbose::out(1,"Registering CEL files for each channel.");
00334 
00335   // Read in cel files
00336   // we could just call readFiles() on each cReader, but if there are
00337   // cross dependencies between the channels, this will not work. For example
00338   // if there is a chip stream node in one channel which corrects for cross
00339   // talk and thus needs values from an earlier step in all the other channels
00340   cReader.setFiles(celFiles);
00341   cReader.readFiles();
00342 
00343   //
00344   // Loop through all of our probe sets and do an expression quantification for each one.
00345   // @todo: perhaps here is a place to kick in the QCprobesetOptions
00346 
00347   for(unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00348     // Verbose::progressStep(1);
00349     //ProbeList pList = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00350     ProbeSet* ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(probeSets[psIx]);
00351     ProbeSetGroup group(ps);     // psGroup should delete the memory for ps...
00352 
00353     // Verbose::out(4, "processing probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
00354     asStream->doAnalysis(group, *sMart, true);
00355 
00356     ProbeSet m_Aallele;
00357     ProbeSet m_Ballele;
00358     fillInAlleleProbeSets(*ps, m_Aallele, m_Ballele);
00359 
00360     //fillInAlleleProbeSets(*ps, m_Aallele, m_Ballele);
00361 
00362     ///@todo much of this should probably be in a MultiQuantLabelZ
00363     ///      rather than using QuantLabelZ directly. Accessing
00364     ///      m_Results directly is ugly as well.
00365 
00366     // Figure out the channels for this SNP
00367     ///@todo default should be global (ie if we have a channel file, then all probesets must be found in it. only default to 0/1 when there is no channel file)
00368     //int alleleAindex = 0;
00369     //int alleleBindex = 1;
00370 
00371     //m_Aallele.clear();
00372     //m_Ballele.clear();
00373 
00374 //    if(sampleAlleleMap.find(ps->name) != sampleAlleleMap.end()) {
00375 //      alleleAindex = sampleAlleleMap[ps->name][0];
00376 //      alleleBindex = sampleAlleleMap[ps->name][1];
00377 //    } else {
00378 //      Verbose::out(1,"Unable to find probeset " + ToStr(ps->name) + " in channel file. Assuming channels 1 and 2.");
00379 //    }
00380     bool success = true;
00381     std::vector<double> Asignals;
00382     std::vector<double> Bsignals;
00383 
00384     if((asStream->getQuantMethod()) == NULL ) {
00385       Err::errAbort("missing quantMethod...");
00386     }
00387     // Verbose::out(4, "quantMethod is A:" + ToStr(streams[alleleAindex]->getQuantMethod()));
00388     // Verbose::out(4, "quantMethod is A:" + ToStr(streams[alleleBindex]->getQuantMethod()));
00389 
00390     //success = summarizeAllele (&m_Aallele, Asignals, *layout,
00391     // *(iMarts[alleleAindex]), cStreamVec[alleleAindex], pmAdjust, (streams[alleleAindex]->getQuantMethod()), true);
00392     success = summarizeAllele(&m_Aallele,
00393                               Asignals,
00394                               *m_layout,
00395                               *sMart,
00396                               cStream,
00397                               *pmAdjuster,
00398                               asStream->getQuantMethod(),
00399                               true);
00400     // Verbose::out(4, "Asignal is " + ToStr(Asignals[0]));
00401     if (!success) {
00402       Err::errAbort("problem with at MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::summarizeAllele. "
00403                     "Cannot succesfully summarize value for A allele.");
00404     }
00405 
00406     //success = summarizeAllele (&m_Ballele, Bsignals, *layout,
00407     // *(iMarts[alleleBindex]), cStreamVec[alleleBindex], pmAdjust, (streams[alleleBindex]->getQuantMethod()),true);
00408     success = summarizeAllele(&m_Ballele,
00409                               Bsignals,
00410                               *m_layout,
00411                               *sMart,
00412                               cStream,
00413                               *pmAdjuster,
00414                               asStream->getQuantMethod(),
00415                               true);
00416     if (!success) {
00417       Err::errAbort("problem with at MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::summarizeAllele. "
00418                     "Cannot succesfully summarize value for B allele.");
00419     }
00420 
00421     double contrast = -2, strength = -2;
00422     ContrastExtremesStretch(k, Asignals[0], Bsignals[0], contrast, strength);
00423 
00424     //Verbose::out(1, ToStr(ps->name) + ":" +ToStr(Asignals[0]) + ":" + ToStr(Bsignals[0]) + ":" + ToStr(contrast));
00425     //Verbose::out(4, ToStr(ps->name) + "-B:" + ToStr(Bsignals[0]));
00426     //Verbose::out(4, ToStr(ps->name) + "-contrast:" + ToStr(contrast));
00427     contrastValues.push_back(contrast);
00428     //Verbose::out(4, ToStr(ps->name)+": "+ToStr(contrastValues[psIx]));
00429 
00430     //
00431     m_Aallele.clear();
00432     m_Ballele.clear();
00433 
00434     // clear out results for the current probeset
00435     multiQuant.m_Results.clear();
00436   }
00437   //Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00438 
00439   // Free up memory
00440   delete asStream;
00441   delete sMart;
00442 }
00443 
00444 /** summarize an allele using expression summary methods specified*/
00445 /*no report given, hacked from QuantGTypedMethod.cpp summarizedAllele*/
00446 //returns the median summary of each probeset
00447 //Here summaryValues will be the signal intensity for each sample
00448 
00449 bool MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::summarizeAllele(ProbeSet* pSet,
00450                                                      vector<double>& summaryValues,
00451                                                      ChipLayout& layout,
00452                                                      SparseMart& sMart,
00453                                                      std::vector<ChipStream*>* iTrans,
00454                                                      PmAdjuster& pmAdjust,
00455                                                      QuantMethod* quantMethod,
00456                                                      bool lowPrecision)
00457 {
00458   bool success = true;
00459   QuantExprMethod *qeMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(quantMethod);
00460   summaryValues.clear();
00461   /* This is a little interesting as we are spoofing a probeSetGroup for calling
00462      functions but don't want the destructor called while that group thinks it
00463      owns those probesets. */
00464   ProbeSetGroup group(pSet);
00465   //int probesize = group.countPmProbes();
00466   //int probesetsize = group.probeSets.size();
00467   //Verbose::out(4, "countPmProbes() is " + ToStr(probesize));
00468   //Verbose::out(4, "group.probeSets.size() is " + ToStr(probesetsize));
00469   if (!qeMethod->setUp(group, sMart, *iTrans, pmAdjust)) {
00470     success = false;
00471   }
00472   else {
00473     qeMethod->computeEstimate();
00474 
00475     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < qeMethod->getNumTargets(); i++) { //for each metaCelFile
00476       double val = qeMethod->getTargetEffect(i); //get signal intensities of the pSet
00477       if(lowPrecision) {
00478         val = Util::round(val);
00479       }
00480       summaryValues.push_back(val);
00481     }
00482     success = true;
00483   }
00484 
00485   /* clear out probesets to prevent deleting them. */
00486   group.probeSets.clear();
00487   clearProbeSet(*pSet);
00488   return success;
00489 }

00491 /* stolen from QuantLabelZ, QuantGTyoeMethod */
00492 bool MultiChannelHomHiLoCelListener::fillInAlleleProbeSets(const ProbeSet &gtPs, ProbeSet &aAllele, ProbeSet &bAllele) {
00493   /* First set up the probe sets to do the summarization of a and b alleles. */
00494   aAllele.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00495   bAllele.psType = ProbeSet::Expression;
00496   // Set the names for our spoofed probesets with suffix A and B
00497   string name = gtPs.name;
00498   //name += "-A";
00499   aAllele.name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00500   name = gtPs.name;
00501   //name += "-B";
00502   bAllele.name = Util::cloneString(name.c_str());
00503   //int groupOffset = 0; // atoms are stored in blocks for each allele, keep track of which block we're in.
00504   /*  Verbose::out(4, "ProbeSet::Aforward Areverse Bforward Breverse are "
00505       + ToStr(ProbeSet::Aforward) + ", " + ToStr(ProbeSet::Areverse) + ", " + ToStr(ProbeSet::Bforward)
00506       + ", " +ToStr(ProbeSet::Breverse));
00507   */
00508   //Verbose::out(4, "numGroups for " + ToStr(gtPs.name) + " is " + ToStr(gtPs.numGroups));
00509   //for(unsigned int groupIx = 0; groupIx < gtPs.numGroups; groupIx++) {
00510   //Verbose::out(4, "atomsPerGroup for " + ToStr(groupIx) + " is " + ToStr(gtPs.atomsPerGroup[groupIx]));
00511   //assuming one one group
00512 
00513   for (unsigned int atomIx = 0; atomIx < gtPs.atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00514     Atom* a;
00515     //aAllele.atoms.push_back(gtPs.atoms[atomIx]);
00516     a=Atom::deepCopy(*gtPs.atoms[atomIx]);
00517     a->channel_code=0;
00518     aAllele.atoms.push_back(a);
00519     //bAllele.atoms.push_back(gtPs.atoms[atomIx]);
00520     a=Atom::deepCopy(*gtPs.atoms[atomIx]);
00521     a->channel_code=1;
00522     bAllele.atoms.push_back(a);
00523   }
00524   
00525   return true;
00526 }
